summary: This document is a chain of emails from June 2019 among FBI personnel and a forensic interviewer coordinating a conference call to discuss victim interviews in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails show scheduling efforts and mention a requested case brief with the ADIC.

persons.name: Mona
persons.context: Mentioned as having a meeting at 2:30 on a wider variety of subjects; the email chain discusses whether to schedule the Epstein victim interviews call around this meeting.

persons.name: Finnegan
persons.context: Copied on the email chain as someone who supervises CAFIs and would be on the call regarding Epstein victim interviews.

persons.name: Connell
persons.context: Copied on the email chain as someone who supervises CAFIs and would be on the call regarding Epstein victim interviews.

persons.name: ADIC
persons.context: The ADIC requested a case brief on Monday at 3:30, leading to a hard stop at 3:20 for the scheduling of the victim interviews call.

connections.description: Both are supervisors of CAFIs (Child/Adolescent Forensic Interviewers) and are copied on the email chain to discuss Epstein victim interviews.

events.title: Scheduled conference call on Epstein victim interviews
events.description: A conference call was set up for June 28, 2019, at 2 pm Eastern Time to discuss victim interviews in the Epstein case.

events.title: ADIC case brief requested
events.description: The Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) requested a case brief on Monday, July 1, 2019, at 3:30 pm, affecting the scheduling of the victim interviews call.

keyFacts: FBI personnel were actively coordinating a conference call in June 2019 to discuss victim interviews in the Jeffrey Epstein case.
The email chain involves the FBI's Victim Services Division, specifically the Child Victim Services Unit and supervisors of Child/Adolescent Forensic Interviewers (CAFIs).
The scheduling was complicated by other meetings, including one with 'Mona' on wider subjects and a case brief requested by the ADIC.
Multiple email addresses and names are redacted or partially obscured, indicating sensitive internal communications within the FBI and possibly other agencies.
